title: "Get all new Messages" won't download on one email account
content:
Troubleshooting info below. (yes I'm running AVAST) The problem: I have 9 incoming accounts from different providers. Mostly thunderbird downloads them fine. However I find its sometimes necessary to right click and choose a particular account to get messages. On one of the accounts I've noticed it can take more than one try to get the emails.

I've read this https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1425745

Create an exception in your anti-virus software for the Thunderbird profile folder, so that the anti-virus real-time scanner will not scan it. yes done that

Don't let your anti-virus software scan incoming and outgoing messages. Don't let your anti-virus software scan attachments. Don't let your anti-virus software intercept your secure connection to the server. Remove any add-ons your anti-virus software may have installed in Thunderbird.

So basically remove all virus protection???

title: find messages - now only shows the thread conversation?
content:
I opened my Thunderbird and it had just updated itself to a new version which looked quite different. Smaller text in the window and more compact.

It all seemed the same BUT when i search messages using EDIT > FIND > SEARCH MESSAGES ....this will only show search matches of email threads. So for example the date of the first email i sent in a long thread. So if im trying to find a specific email i know i sent on X date, its really hard to find it. Or if i want to see every single email i have sent or received from someone - i cannot see it now - it only shows ONE entry which shows the full thread.

Its really weird because my email folders ( inbox, sent etc ) are not showing as threads or anything.

Whats annoying about it - is the dates showing on the search results is the date the email thread started. So its hard to work out if its the one you want. So lets say I know ive sent someone an email 2 weeks ago....I cannot find it because the search results show the date of the thread starting which could be months earlier!?

Is there a way to use it like before where the search results in find messages just list every single email that matches the criteria set?
